p: Natural compounds are highly investigated for treating a broad spectrum of diseases and those manifesting antiviral activity might be of great use as adjuvants in COVID-19 therapies. For instance, Khaerunnisa et al. investigated the ability of some natural compounds such as kaempferol, quercetin, oleuropein, curcumin, catechin, and others to serve as potential inhibitor candidates for the SARS-CoV-2 main protease (Mpro). According to their paper, the affinity of kaempferol to Mpro is higher than that of other natural compounds and comparable to some FDA-approved drugs such as nelfinavir and lopinavir [ 133].
